result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio Miquel Colorez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court finds defendant eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after 1 year of confinement.
Consecutive to: 18CF5493

superMiscConds.notes:
lf extended supervision is revoked and the defendant will have a mandatory release from prison, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due. 

Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and comply with recommendations.
Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments, and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with recommendations.

records.addlTxt: Same appearances. State moves to delete the Repeater Enhancer; Court grants amendment.  Guilty plea entered as amended. Court finds def guilty on Count 1 as amended and enters judgment.  Defendant makes statements.

Attorney Edgar A Beltran in court for Antonio Miquel Colorez.  (22TR1097)  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information.
